intro: Psychotria brachyandra, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon Basin. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria brachyandra is also noted for its role in supporting local biodiversity, particularly as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
